pullRequest.title: Follow the same way that BigQuery handles unspecified or duplicate ZetaSQL STRUCT field name
pullRequest.bodyText:
#12507 revealed a bug related to duplicate STRUCT field name. This PR fix it by following the same way that BigQuery handles unspecified or duplicate field name.
r: @apilloud
cc: @youngoli (2.24 release manager, this is a fix for a previous PR)

commit.message: Follow the same way that BigQuery handles unspecified or duplicate ZetaSQL STRUCT field name

nodes.bodyText:
This does not actually match the behavior of BigQuery. To match BigQuery you should remove the HashSet and instead replace anything starting with _field_ with the correct index for that column.
(In BigQuery, this condition would be "".equals(name) || name.startsWith("_field_"))
